member.name: M:CodeSmith.Data.Linq.DataContextExtensions.ExecuteCommand(System.Data.Linq.DataContext,System.Data.Common.DbCommand)
member.summary: Executes a SQL statement against a connection.
member.param: The to execute the batch select against.
The DbCommand to execute.
member.returns: The number of rows affected.
member.remarks: The DbCommand is not disposed by this call, the caller must dispose the DbCommand.

member.name: M:CodeSmith.Data.Linq.DataContextExtensions.ExecuteQuery(System.Data.Linq.DataContext,System.Linq.IQueryable[])
member.summary: Batches together multiple queries into a single and returns all data in a single round trip to the database.
member.param: The to execute the batch select against.
Represents a collections of SELECT queries to execute.
member.returns: Returns an object containing all results.
member.exception: Thrown when context or queries are null.

member.name: M:CodeSmith.Data.Linq.TableExtensions.Delete``1(System.Data.Linq.Table{``0},System.Linq.IQueryable{``0})
member.summary: Immediately deletes all entities from the collection with a single delete command.
member.typeparam: Represents the object type for rows contained in .
member.param: Represents a table for a particular type in the underlying database containing rows to be deleted.
Represents the collection of items which are to be removed from .
member.returns: The number of rows deleted from the database.

remarks.para: Similar to stored procedures, and opposite from DeleteAllOnSubmit, rows provided in will be deleted immediately with no need to call .
Additionally, to improve performance, instead of creating a delete command for each item in , a single delete command is created.

member.name: M:CodeSmith.Data.Linq.TableExtensions.Delete``1(System.Data.Linq.Table{``0},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Boolean}})
member.summary: Immediately deletes all entities from the collection with a single delete command.
member.typeparam: Represents the object type for rows contained in .
member.param: Represents a table for a particular type in the underlying database containing rows to be deleted.
Represents a filter of items to be deleted in .
member.returns: The number of rows deleted from the database.

member.name: M:CodeSmith.Data.Linq.TableExtensions.Update``1(System.Data.Linq.Table{``0},System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,``0}})
member.summary: Immediately updates all entities in the collection with a single update command based on a created from a Lambda expression.
member.typeparam: Represents the object type for rows contained in .
member.param: Represents a table for a particular type in the underlying database containing rows to be updated.
Represents the collection of items which are to be updated in .
A Lambda expression returning a that defines the update assignments to be performed on each item in .
member.returns: The number of rows updated in the database.

remarks.para: Similar to stored procedures, and opposite from InsertAllOnSubmit, rows provided in will be updated immediately with no need to call .
Additionally, to improve performance, instead of creating an update command for each item in , a single update command is created.

member.name: M:CodeSmith.Data.Linq.TableExtensions.Update``1(System.Data.Linq.Table{``0},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Boolean}},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,``0}})
member.summary: Immediately updates all entities in the collection with a single update command based on a created from a Lambda expression.
member.typeparam: Represents the object type for rows contained in .
member.param: Represents a table for a particular type in the underlying database containing rows to be updated.
Represents a filter of items to be updated in .
A Lambda expression returning a that defines the update assignments to be performed on each item in .
member.returns: The number of rows updated in the database.
